entries.title: Man travels from Wales to Turkey to find family buried in rubble
entries.description: We meet Ahmat at one of the few functioning airports in the earthquake zone.

entries.title: When the roar of heavy diggers stops, the sound of silence that no one wants to hear
entries.description: In the Turkish city of Osmaniye, the sound of silence is something no one wants to hear.

entries.title: 'So heartbreaking': Love Island star Ekin-Su eager to volunteer in Turkey - and reveals family have been caught in disaster
entries.description: Love Island star Ekin-Su Cülcüloğlu has told Sky News she would like to volunteer to help with the earthquake relief efforts in Turkey and Syria.

entries.title: Photos show downed Chinese 'spy balloon' being pulled from ocean
entries.description: Photos from the US navy show the downed suspected Chinese spy balloon being removed by hand from the Atlantic Ocean.

entries.title: Social media users offer aid and share information in disaster-struck Turkey
entries.description: "The first floor of my house in Istanbul is empty. I'm ready to help anyone with shelter and catering."

entries.title: Gruesome, technical work: How an earthquake search and rescue mission is conducted
entries.description: A collapsed building is a "hostile, horrific" place to be trapped, retired firefighter Rob Davis says.

entries.title: What makes these parts of Turkey and Syria among the worst places in the world for an earthquake to happen
entries.description: This is one of the worst parts of the world for an earthquake to happen.

entries.title: Three British nationals missing after Turkey-Syria earthquake
entries.description: Three British nationals are missing following the earthquakes which struck Turkey and Syria, the foreign secretary has said.

entries.title: 'We're being left to die': Anger and frustration as search for trapped relatives continues
entries.description: The people of Antakya are not only desperate, there is real anger here too.

entries.title: What is an aftershock - and what is a 'strike-slip' earthquake?
entries.description: Two powerful earthquakes and dozens of aftershocks have wrought incalculable destruction on parts of Turkey and Syria, with much of the devastation hitting communities already vulnerable following a decade of war.

entries.title: How technology can be used to help respond to natural disasters
entries.description: Rescue efforts continue following the devastating earthquakes which struck Turkey and Syria.

entries.title: Moment young girl pulled from rubble of building in Syria
entries.description: Footage has emerged from Syria of the incredible moment men digging through rubble with their hands freed a tiny girl as her father tries to keep her calm.

entries.title: 'I was waiting for our deaths': Earthquake survivors share their stories as rescue effort continues
entries.description: Rescue workers from around the world are scouring the rubble of destroyed buildings in Turkey and Syria after two powerful earthquakes left at least 5,000 people dead across both countries.

entries.title: Crews release toxic chemicals from derailed freight train to avert explosion after evacuation
entries.description: Rail crews in Ohio have been burning off toxic chemicals from a freight train that derailed last week, after ordering nearly 2,000 residents to evacuate their homes.

entries.title: Women are crying, destruction is everywhere and overwhelmed rescuers need urgent help
entries.description: In the city of Diyarbakir in southeast Turkey we found a tragically typical scene in the wake of the earthquake.

entries.title: Which countries have offered to help Turkey and Syria and what aid are they providing?
entries.description: Dozens of countries around the world have rushed to dispatch aid after a powerful earthquake left more than 5,000 people dead across Turkey and Syria.

entries.title: Volunteers digging with their bare hands as shouts heard amid the rubble
entries.description: When we arrived in Antakya near the Syrian border, we were met with a pretty grim scene.

entries.title: 5,600 buildings destroyed by quake in Turkey - as civil war complicates rescue efforts in Syria
entries.description: More than 5,600 buildings in Turkey have been destroyed by yesterday's powerful earthquake and aftershocks - as the long-running civil war in Syria complicates rescue efforts there.

entries.title: Suspected Chinese 'spy balloon' was same size as 20-storey building, US military says
entries.description: A suspected Chinese spy balloon that was shot down by the US over the weekend was 60m (200ft) tall - comparable to a 20-storey building.
